title: Hamlet
occurrences: I do not know from what pan of the world I should be greeted, if not from Lord Hamlet
He that thou knowest thine, Hamlet
- Letters, my lord from Hamlet - Who brought them?
...when I shall recount the occasion of my sudden and most strange return. Hamlet
- Why ask you this'? - Hamlet returns. What would you undertake...
...I came to it that day that our last King Hamlet o'ercame Fortinbras
It was the very day that young Hamlet was born, he that was mad and sent into England
I hoped thou wouldst have been my Hamlet's wife
- This is I, Hamlet the Dane - The devil take thy soul
- Pluck them asunder - Hamlet, Hamlet! - Good my lord
You have been talked of since your travel much, and that in Hamlet's hearing...
Come Hamlet, come and take this hand from me
- Hamlet, you know the wager - Very well, my lord
If Hamlet give the first or second hit the king shall drink to Hamlet's better health
- Hamlet, this pearl is thine - I'll play this bout first, set by a while
It is here Hamlet. Hamlet, thou an slain
Exchange forgiveness with me, noble Hamlet
